DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether propranolol is better than oxytocin for the treatment of labor abnormalities. The endpoint is the rate of vaginal delivery experienced by women receiving prolonged oxytocin versus propranolol.
DOC.brief_title: Trial of Oxytocin Alone Versus Oxytocin and Propranolol for the Treatment of Abnormal Labor
DOC.detailed_description: This trial was designed to test if propranolo can reduce the c section rate for dysfuctional labor. Due to stringent inclution and exclusion criteria and low enrollment the study was closed.
DOC.criteria: Must be term pregnancy (> 37 weeks) Vertex presentation Active labor (45 centimeters dilated) Heart disease Diabetes Currently taking propranolol Contraindications to labor or vaginal delivery Multiple gestations Preterm Chorioamnionitis
